Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset=US-ASCII;
	delsp=yes;
	format=flowed

The MATLAB toolbox in the MSI installer was created using MATLAB  
2006b.  So maybe it is a difference between 2006a and 2006b. At some  
point recently, the MATLAB people changed the file extension for MEX  
files on Windows from "dll" to "mexw32". Cantera implements this  
change, but maybe your older MATLAB is still expecting an extension  
of "dll".  I would suggest that you either upgrade your MATLAB  
version, or compile Cantera from source code, which will probably  
work with older versions, and edit the SetupCantera project to  
install ctmethods.dll, instead of ctmethods.mexw32 (if that is the  
problem).



On Nov 16, 2006, at 5:56 AM, Steven C. DeCaluwe wrote:

>
> Hello Everybody,
>
> After completing the following steps:
> -running the msi installer for windows (Windows XP, Matlab2006a)
> -installing Python 2.5
> -installing the related numarray
> -running Cantera-1.7.0.win32-py2.5.exe, and
> -changing the environment 'Path' variable to find Python 2.5,  
> rather than 2.4
>
> I get the following error when I try to make Cantera objects in  
> Matlab from any cti file (I've tried using the 'air' function, as  
> well as 'importPhase'
>
> ---------------------------------------------------------------------- 
> ---------------------------------------------------------------------- 
> --
> ??? Invalid MEX-file 'C:\Program Files\Cantera\MATLAB\toolbox 
> \cantera\ctmethods.mexw32': The specified procedure could not be  
> found.
>
> .
>
> Error in ==> XML_Node.XML_Node at 11
>    x.id = ctmethods(10,15,0,src); % newxml(name)
>
> Error in ==> Solution.Solution at 30
> doc = XML_Node('doc',src);
>
> Error in ==> importPhase at 7
>   s = Solution(file, name);
> ---------------------------------------------------------------------- 
> ---------------------------------------------------------------------- 
> ---
>
> Any idea what this could be?  Has anyone else experienced this  
> problem?  Several of us at the University of Maryland have run into  
> it w/ the 1.7 release.  Could it be an error with my 'mex -setup'?
>
> Thanks,
> Steven DeCaluwe
>
>
>
> Check out the all-new Yahoo! Mail beta - Fire up a more powerful  
> email and get things done faster. 


--Apple-Mail-3-698208959

	charset=ISO-8859-1
